com.here.android.mpa.search

Class PlaceRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.search.Request<Place>
      • com.here.android.mpa.search.PlaceRequest

  • public class PlaceRequest
extends Request<Place>
    Represents an extended Request used to retrieve a Place object by way of Places search services.
    See Also:
    ExploreRequest, HereRequest, SearchRequest

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlaceRequest

        public PlaceRequest(PlaceLink placeLink)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        placeLink - A selected PlaceLink found using a discovery request.

      • PlaceRequest

        public PlaceRequest(java.lang.String source,
                    java.lang.String id)
        Creates a PlaceRequest based on an external reference source and identifier.
        Parameters:
        source - Name of the external reference source.
        id - The identifier of the requested place in external system.
        See Also:
        Places (Search) API Developer's Guide, Request.addReference(String), Request.PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_CONTENT_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_DESTINATION_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_VENUE_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, PlaceLink.getReference(String), Place.getReference(String)

    • Method Detail

      • getRichTextFormatting

        public RichTextFormatting getRichTextFormatting()
        Gets the current RichTextFormatting type being used in request responses. The default formatting is RichTextFormatting.HTML.
        Returns:
        The current RichTextFormatting type

      • setRichTextFormatting

        public PlaceRequest setRichTextFormatting(RichTextFormatting value)
        Sets a RichTextFormatting to be used in request responses.
        Parameters:
        value - Desired RichTextFormatting
        Returns:
        This PlaceRequest object

      • addReference

        public PlaceRequest addReference(java.lang.String name)
        This function adds the name of a requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.

        For example, to retrieve an POI identifier (pvid), set this value to Request#PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME.

        Overrides:
        addReference in class Request<Place>
        Parameters:
        name - Name of reference identifier to retrieve.
        Returns:
        True if name added, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Places (Search) API Developer's Guide, Request.PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_CONTENT_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_DESTINATION_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request.VENUES_VENUE_ID_REFERENCE_NAME

      • getReferences

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReferences()
        This function returns the names of requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.
        Overrides:
        getReferences in class Request<Place>
        Returns:
        List of the names of reference identifiers to be returned in the result.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, PlaceRequest

      • addImageDimensions

        public void addImageDimensions(int width,
                               int height)
        Request Image Media with specific dimensions. At least one of the sizes (width or height) needs to be valid (greater than 0).
        Parameters:
        width - Image width (pass 0 for any width)
        height - Image height (pass 0 for any height)

      • addContent

        public void addContent(java.lang.String placeContent)
        Requests specific EditorialMedia by providing one of the available place content sources. Currently only Request.PLACE_CONTENT_WIKIPEDIA is available.
        Parameters:
        placeContent - non-empty name for place content source.
        See Also:
        Request.PLACE_CONTENT_WIKIPEDIA, Place.getEditorials(), EditorialMedia

      • getContent

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getContent()
        Returns the names of requested place content sources that was added using PlaceRequest.addContent(String).
        Returns:
        non-null list of the content source names.

      • execute

        public ErrorCode execute(ResultListener<Place> listener)
        Executes an asynchronous request.
        Overrides:
        execute in class Request<Place>
        Parameters:
        listener - A ResultListener passed along with the request to monitor progress
        Returns:
        The ErrorCode representing an appropriate result
